title: 114_hr2332
content:
The Act titled "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2015" establishes a Transformational Infrastructure Competitive Grant Program. The "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2015" establishes a transformational infrastructure competitive grant program under the Secretary of Transportation, allowing grants to be awarded to state governments, local governments, transit agencies, and port authorities for eligible projects such as highway or bridge improvements. The "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2015" establishes a competitive grant program for infrastructure projects including seismic retrofit projects for bridges, road realignments, public transportation projects, passenger or freight rail projects, port infrastructure investments, aviation infrastructure projects, and water infrastructure projects. Coordination with EPA and Army required for water infrastructure projects. The "Nation Building Here at Home Act of 2015" establishes a competitive grant program for infrastructure projects. Eligible entities must submit applications meeting specified criteria, including financial commitments from non-Federal sources. The Secretary will issue regulations within 90 days to guide grant awards. The Federal share of project costs under the grant program cannot exceed 100%. Grants must be distributed equitably, address urban and rural needs, promote veteran employment, and support small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals. Projects must comply with Title 40 requirements and adhere to Buy America provisions. The Buy America provision in the Act requires that all iron, steel, and manufactured goods used in a project must be produced in the United States, with exceptions allowed if it's in the public interest, or if the items are not available in sufficient quantities or quality domestically, or if using American products would increase project costs by more than 25%. If a waiver is necessary, the Secretary must justify it publicly. The Secretary must justify any waiver publicly, in accordance with international agreements. The program must ensure grants are used efficiently, with transparency through public information and congressional reporting. The Secretary must also coordinate with relevant federal departments for environmental streamlining. Authorization of Appropriations: The Secretary is authorized to appropriate $985 billion for grants under the program from 2016 to 2020. Funds will be allocated for various project categories as outlined in subsection (c)(1). The Secretary is authorized to appropriate $985 billion for grants under the program from 2016 to 2020, with 9 percent allocated for projects described in subparagraph (F) of subsection (c)(1). The Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Secretary of Transportation, will establish a Nation Building Here at Home Financing Initiative within 180 days of the enactment of this Act. The initiative allows the issuance of bonds up to $300 billion, with specific terms set by the Treasury Secretary. Proceeds from the bonds will be used by the Secretary of Transportation for the program established under section 2(a) of the Act. Additionally, a report is required as part of the initiative. SEC. 4. REPORT.

Within 180 days of the Act's enactment, the Secretary of Transportation must submit a report to Congress outlining the transportation needs of the United States for the next 20, 30, and 50 years.
